snippet.title: ⭐ Super Mario 64 PC Port - Mods - Super Mario Odyssey: Mario moveset v1.0.1 - 4K 60FPS
snippet.description:
▶▶▶Patreon◀◀◀
https://www.patreon.com/unrealyoutube/
▶▶▶Twitter◀◀◀
https://twitter.com/Unreal_64
▶▶▶My PC◀◀◀
https://www.amazon.com/shop/unreal

***All Super Mario Odyssey: Mario moveset videos***

v1.5.7
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xEN9GvGMSPY
v1.0.1 (compatible with Render96 1.4.2)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hbPxvb1gn1c
v1.0.1
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cFf0_8x0CiY
v0.11 (fixed patch)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DW2My2yX_ds
v0.11
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTf8FNggrVY

Super Mario Odyssey - Mario moveset v1.0.1
http://sm64pc.info/forum/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=86
by PeachyPeach

Also included in sm64pcbuilder2
https://sm64pc.info/sm64pcbuilder2/

⭐ Tutorial - How to compile Super Mario 64 PC Port with sm64pcBuilder2
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rW9IotsB9pA
⭐ Tutorial - Cómo compilar PC Port de Super Mario 64 con sm64pcBuilder2
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XqswBC_WYa8

***Version 1.bob***

Changes and fixes:

Mario takes off his cap when Cappy is thrown. (Thanks to $4Y$ and Martin Pham)

Mario's wall slide is faster.
Metal Mario can punch and jump kick under water.

Mario turns while throwing Cappy, making him able to change direction airborne.

Cappy's throw is now bound to a new button (not the B button anymore).
You'll have to go to the Options menu, Controls sub-menu and bind keys for the "X button".
Cappy can be thrown in a way that it orbits around Mario by pressing (X) and (A) simultaneously.

A sub-menu "Super Mario Odyssey" is available in the Options menu.
You can choose from here Mario's moveset and if you want to enable or disable Cappy.
By default, Mario's moveset is set to "64 moveset" and Cappy is disabled.

Two new cheats have been added to the *secret* Cheats sub-menu:
"Unlimited Cappy jumps" and "Cappy stays forever". (Thanks to $4Y$ for the idea)

New stuff:
You wanted it, here it is. Now, Mario can capture and possess his enemies! (Well, currently, a few ones)

In the "Super Mario Odyssey" sub-menu, set Cappy to "Capture".
Throw Cappy to an enemy, and it will try to possess it. Each enemy has a unique way to move and act.
For this version, only the enemies present in Bob-omb Battlefield are capturable.
This includes Goomba, Koopa, Bob-omb, Bob-omb buddy, Bob-omb King and Chain Chomp.
Press (Z) while possessing an enemy to leave it. Mario automatically leaves his possession if he takes damage.

Goomba
This little boy can walk, run by holding (B) and jump by pressing (A).
If you jump on another goomba, you can create a Goomba stack.
Jump on other ones to make your stack grow. (with a limit of 8 Goombas)

Koopa (shelled)
This one can walk, jump by pressing (A), and shell-slide by holding (B).
Shell-sliding has the same properties as Mario while he rides a shell: knockback enemies, travel on lava...
Note: Koopa the Quick is not capturable.

Koopa (unshelled)
The other one can't shell-slide, but can run (for his life).
He can get his shell back if he touches it.

Bob-omb
Bob-omb can't run, but launches a destructive explosion when pressing (B).
His explosion destroys enemies and brick blocks.

Bob-omb buddy
Mario can't move him around, but reads his dialog without having to talk to him.
Mario is automatically ejected when the dialog ends.
The "opens cannon" variant is also capturable.

Bob-omb king
Just try to capture him.

Chain chomp
While possessing Chain chomp, Mario can move, do big hops by holding (A) and perform a bite attack by pressing (B).
He's restricted to his chain attached to the wooden post, but can break free if he tries to bite while his chain is fully stretched.
When freed, this massive iron ball is invulnerable and knockbacks enemies on contact, and can even break brick blocks and some walls by biting them.
Note: Freed chain chomp has a new behavior when Mario leaves it: he will start to chase Mario if he is too close to him.

#sm64pc #sm64 #supermario64 #mod #4k #60fps #gameplay #unreal #moveset #odyssey #mario #smo #OMM
